document.docAuthor: Palma, Ricardo L. & Peck, Stewart B.
document.masterDocTitle: <strong> An annotated checklist of parasitic lice (Insecta: Phthiraptera) from the Galápagos Islands </ strong>

subSubSection.paragraph:
Galápagos hosts:
Oceanites gracilis galapagoensis Lowe, 1921
;
Oceanodroma tethys tethys (Bonaparte, 1852)
;
Oceanodroma castro (Harcourt, 1851)
.

Material examined: 43 males , 34 females and 69 nymphs (12 samples, EMEC , MONZ )
.

Remarks: This species was placed in the subgenus
Synnautes
Thompson, 1936
in many publications, but Palma (2011: 16) has synonymised
Synnautes
under the nominate subgenus
Halipeurus
. Palma (2011: 28) recorded
Halipeurus pelagicus
from nine species of storm petrels, including the three Galápagos hosts listed above. From the Kellogg Collection, we examined the lectotype male, one paralectotype female and one paralectotype male of
Lipeurus languidus
, plus five specimens reported by Kellogg (1906: 319) as “
Lipeurus languidus
” from
Oceanites gracilis
, and we have identified them as
Halipeurus pelagicus
.
